metadata.title: CVE-2021-40330 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
git_connect_git in connect.c in Git before 2.30.1 allows a repository pathto contain a newline character, which may result in unexpectedcross-protocol requests, as demonstrated by thegit://localhost:1234/%0d%0a%0d%0aGET%20/%20HTTP/1.1 substring.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-40330` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

git - 1:2.17.1-1ubuntu0.9
git-all - 1:2.17.1-1ubuntu0.9
git-cvs - 1:2.17.1-1ubuntu0.9
git-daemon-run - 1:2.17.1-1ubuntu0.9
git-daemon-sysvinit - 1:2.17.1-1ubuntu0.9
git-el - 1:2.17.1-1ubuntu0.9
git-email - 1:2.17.1-1ubuntu0.9
git-gui - 1:2.17.1-1ubuntu0.9
git-man - 1:2.17.1-1ubuntu0.9
git-mediawiki - 1:2.17.1-1ubuntu0.9
git-svn - 1:2.17.1-1ubuntu0.9
gitk - 1:2.17.1-1ubuntu0.9
gitweb - 1:2.17.1-1ubuntu0.9
No subscription required

criterions.comment: git package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:2.17.1-1ubuntu0.9').
